Key Arguments: The legislation poses a threat to freedom of speech in Australia.
It could lead to government overreach in policing online speech.
There is potential for abuse by the government to silence dissenting opinions.
The bill could lead to unintended consequences by stifling public discourse.
Censorship is not compatible with a free society and more speech should be encouraged instead.
Notable Quotes: The effects of this bill will give Government... the power to force social media companies to police the speech of all citizens in ways that could adversely threaten the democratic functioning of society.

The scope for the abuse of democracy by using this legislation to shut up or silence opinions that the government of the day does not like or approve of, is truly Orwellian and must be rejected in the strongest possible terms.
Censorship is not compatible with debate in a free society and it is concerning that this proposed legislation is even being considered in Australia.
